DataElement.preferredName: Assessment of Motor and Process Skills ADL Motor Skills Total Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value representing the total score of the Activities of Daily Living (ADL) motor skills portion of the Assessment of Motor and Process Skills (AMPS), an observational assessment that is used to measure the quality of a person's activities of daily living (ADL); the quality of the person's ADL performance is assessed by rating the effort, efficiency, safety, and independence of 16 ADL motor and 20 ADL process skill items.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Assessment of Motor and Process Skills Assessment Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 30-item, self-reported questionnaire designed to measure physical and social function along with symptom impact associated with musculosketetal disorders of the upper limb._Having determined the value, significance, or extent of._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._An observational assessment that is used to measure the quality of a person's activities of daily living (ADL).  The quality of the person's ADL preformance is assessed by rating the effort, efficiency, safety, and independence of 16 ADL motor and 20 ADL process skill items._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Assessment of Motor and Process Skills
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An observational assessment that is used to measure the quality of a person's activities of daily living (ADL).  The quality of the person's ADL preformance is assessed by rating the effort, efficiency, safety, and independence of 16 ADL motor and 20 ADL process skill items.
